author: Brian Turner
method: Preheat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. For the pâté, place all of the ingredients into a food processor and pulse until smooth. Transfer the mixture into two greased ramekins or dariole moulds and place into a roasting tin filled with enough water to reach half way up the sides of the moulds when they are placed in the tin. (This is called a bain-marie.) Place into the oven to cook for 15 minutes, or until completely cooked through. To serve, turn out the pâté from the moulds onto plates, sprinkle with the chives and serve with the toasted ciabatta.
ingredients: 150g/5½oz chicken livers, trimmed,  50ml/2fl oz double cream,  2 whole free-range eggs,  1 tsp port,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  1 tsp fresh chives, chopped ,  4 slices ciabatta, toasted
